glsa.title: PECL APC: Buffer Overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability in PECL APC might allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: PECL Alternative PHP Cache (PECL APC) is a free, open, and robust framework for caching and optimizing PHP intermediate code.

description.p: Daniel Papasian discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the apc_search_paths() function in the file apc.c when processing long filenames.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in PHP applications that pass user-controlled input to the include() function.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
